info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 27 at 7:50PM MDT until June 27 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... West central Hidalgo County in southwestern New Mexico...
* Until 915 PM MDT.
* At 748 PM MDT, thunderstorms were developing just north of Lordsburg Playa, while easterly outflow winds were gusting over 35 mph at Lordsburg airport. Gusty winds from the east will reach Lordsburg Playa shortly, and may be followed by wind from the thunderstorms to the north. Either way, blowing dust is likely to develop soon over Lordsburg Playa.
HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong winds up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 17.
Locations impacted include... Steins, Cotton City, Road Forks, and Lordsburg Playa.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
If winds intensify further, Dust Storm Warnings may be required.
